main.java.ui

Class GameUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
              • main.java.ui.GameUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class GameUI
extends javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
    GameUI is a BorderPane that handles all the UI elements. It also has a few convenience methods. The controller is synchronized.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameUI

        public GameUI(Controller control,
              SudokuLoader splash)
        Creates a complete visual representation of the current Sudoku Game.
        Parameters:
        control - The current controller for this game.
        splash - The Splash Screen (Deprecated!)

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Gets the Board that represents the current game.
        Returns:
        A Board of this game (FX).

      • getMenu

        public ButtonMenu getMenu()
        Gets the current ButtonMenu that is positioned on the left.
        Returns:
        The current ButtonMenu.

      • getInfo

        public InfoMenu getInfo()
        Gets the current ToolBar that is positioned on the top.
        Returns:
        A ToolBar that has all the player information.

      • getSolnBoard

        public int[][] getSolnBoard()
        A synchronized method that gets the Solution Board. This is a convenience method that retrieves the Solution from the controller.
        Returns:
        A double-layered integer array that represents the solution.

      • setSolnBoard

        public void setSolnBoard(int[][] solnBoard)
        A synchronized method that sets the solution board. This is a convenience method that sets the Solution board of the controller.
        Parameters:
        solnBoard - A double-layered int array that represents the solution.

      • getControl

        public Controller getControl()
        Gets the controller.
        Returns:
        The current game's controller.

      • getChat

        public Chat getChat()
        Gets the Side Chat positioned on the right side.
        Returns:
        The current game's chat log.

      • getChatter

        public Chatter getChatter()
        Gets the User's chat sender, positioned on the bottom side.
        Returns:
        The current game's chat sender.
